intro: Tragopogon pusillus, commonly known as the dwarf goatsbeard, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive leaf morphology. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring and summer months. Tragopogon pusillus is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a short-lived perennial species.
